alert.note: Alert for Teton (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 24 at 11:09AM MDT until further notice by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Pacific Creek near Moran affecting Teton County. .Slightly above normal temperatures persist through the week with scattered afternoon and evening showers and thunderstorms, especially Thursday and Friday. Therefore, active snowmelt continues in the mountains and allows for high water flows. For the Snake River Basin...including Moran...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Pacific Creek near Moran. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Bankfull stage. Minor low level flooding along lower banks. At 7.7 feet, Record flow---5,790 cfs (5/23/2006). At 8.0 feet, Record stage---(5/21/2008). At 8.0 feet, Flood stage. Flooding of upstream USFS campground on right bank. Minor lowland flooding intensifies and becomes more widespread. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM MDT Wednesday the stage was 7.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate below flood stage between 7.2 and 7.8 feet through the weekend. - Action stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
